items.title: Notre Dame Football: Offensive Lineman Billy Schrauth out multiple weeks with knee injury
items.summary: Despite all of the joy and dominance on the field Saturday night in Notre Dame’s 34-24 victory over USC, one of the few bad things to come out of the game is that Irish offensive lineman, Billy Schrauth, will miss multiple weeks with a knee injury. The captain from Wisconsin was having a dominant performance […]

items.title: Notre Dame Football Stats: 2025-26 Week 8 Review of Win over USC
items.summary: Another season, another stressful USC game.  Me and some close alum friends had very nostalgic moments in the text threads mulling about whether or not the Irish were going to pull off the big win or serve us up another rivalry heartbreak.  Fortunately, it ended well for the program and us personally.  Notre Dame finished […]

items.title: 2025 Notre Dame Football Schedule, TV Times, Stat Leaders, Roster, and Results
items.summary: The Notre Dame football season is up and running — and we’re already putting holes in walls. Despite the loss in Miami, and against Texas A&M, the Irish still have a chance to bring home its 23rd national championship. The gang here at OFD is still pretty pumped to give you the best overall coverage […]

items.title: How Notre Dame’s opponents fared in week 8 of the college football season
items.summary: Notre Dame got off to a rough start in 2025, but they looked like they fixed a few things in a 56-30 win over the Purdue Boilermakers and then the 56-13 win on the road against the Arkansas Razorbacks. They followed those two victories with two victories which covered massive spreads in a 28-7 win […]

items.title: Notre Dame Football is fighting and clawing its way back up the mountain
items.summary: Notre Dame was first pushed and then kicked off of the mountain with its 0-2 start to the Miami Hurricanes and Texas A&M Aggies. Just as the Irish did last year following the loss to Northern Illinois, Notre Dame has continued to beat down its opponent to claw its way back up the rankings mountain. […]
